intro: Trimeranthes, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Amaranthaceae. These plants are native to southern Africa and are characterized by their distinctive, star-shaped flowers. Trimeranthes species typically have succulent leaves and stems, which help them survive in arid environments. They are often grown as ornamental plants due to their vibrant colors and unique appearance. The genus includes several species, such as Trimeranthes pauciflora, which is popular in horticulture.
